etymology.description: 企 ‘to stand on tiptoe; plan; expect’ + 图/圖 ‘plan; scheme; attempt’ = intend/attempt (often with ulterior motive).
etymology.interpretation: Combines a sense of reaching/aspiring with planning or scheming, yielding ‘to attempt; intend’, commonly with a negative or clandestine undertone. Often contrasts with neutral 尝试/嘗試.
etymology.simplification: 圖 → 图: interior components were reduced to a simpler form to ease writing while preserving pronunciation and meaning; 企 unchanged.

parts.english: stand on tiptoe; expect; plan; enterprise

examples.chinese: 他企图通过作弊获得高分(他企圖通過作弊獲得高分)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qǐtú tōngguò zuòbì huòdé gāofēn.
examples.english: He attempted to get a high score by cheating.

examples.chinese: 警方挫败了一伙人企图抢劫银行的计划(警方挫敗了一伙人企圖搶劫銀行的計劃)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐngfāng cuòbài le yì huǒ rén qǐtú qiǎngjié yínháng de jìhuà.
examples.english: The police foiled a gang’s plan to rob a bank.

examples.chinese: 他企图逃跑但被当场抓住(他企圖逃跑但被當場抓住)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qǐtú táopǎo dàn bèi dāngchǎng zhuāzhù.
examples.english: He tried to run away but was caught on the spot.
